title: How to Draw a Basketball

steps.headline: Draw a perfect circle.
steps.description: You can use a protractor or a compass to guide you in drawing a perfect circle. Sketch a circle using a pencil first, and then trace the line using a marker.

steps.headline: Begin with a sketch of a perfect circle outline.
steps.description: Use your pencil to lightly sketch a perfect circle.

steps.headline: Add lines to show the actual shape of the ball.
steps.description: You can show a sphere by adding the perspective.

steps.headline: Start coloring the draft.
steps.description: Choose the basic color in beginning the coloring.

steps.headline: Continue coloring.
steps.description: Choose a color that is lighter than the basic color. Put it where the brighter areas should be shown which means that is where the light is being reflected.

steps.headline: Add the darker shades.
steps.description: To show a more realistic approach to the drawing, add the shades and shadow. This way, the basketball will appear like a sphere.

steps.headline: Draw four lines on the ball.
steps.description: Two lines which are a vertical and a horizontal line in the middle simply follow the shape of the ball. The other two lines are curved lines conforming to the shape of the ball.

text: Basketball Icon Design Draw a perfect circle. You can use a protractor or a compass to guide you in drawing a perfect circle. Sketch a circle using a pencil first, and then trace the line using a marker. Draw a straight vertical line.  Draw two curved vertical lines.  Color the draft.  Realistic Basketball Begin with a sketch of a perfect circle outline. Use your pencil to lightly sketch a perfect circle. Add lines to show the actual shape of the ball. You can show a sphere by adding the perspective. Start coloring the draft. Choose the basic color in beginning the coloring. Continue coloring. Choose a color that is lighter than the basic color. Put it where the brighter areas should be shown which means that is where the light is being reflected. Blend the colors.  Add the darker shades. To show a more realistic approach to the drawing, add the shades and shadow. This way, the basketball will appear like a sphere. Draw four lines on the ball. Two lines which are a vertical and a horizontal line in the middle simply follow the shape of the ball. The other two lines are curved lines conforming to the shape of the ball. Color the background.
sentences: Basketball Icon Design Draw a perfect circle.
You can use a protractor or a compass to guide you in drawing a perfect circle.
Sketch a circle using a pencil first, and then trace the line using a marker.
Draw a straight vertical line.
Draw two curved vertical lines.
Color the draft.
Realistic Basketball Begin with a sketch of a perfect circle outline.
Use your pencil to lightly sketch a perfect circle.
Add lines to show the actual shape of the ball.
You can show a sphere by adding the perspective.
Start coloring the draft.
Choose the basic color in beginning the coloring.
Continue coloring.
Choose a color that is lighter than the basic color.
Put it where the brighter areas should be shown which means that is where the light is being reflected.
Blend the colors.
Add the darker shades.
To show a more realistic approach to the drawing, add the shades and shadow.
This way, the basketball will appear like a sphere.
Draw four lines on the ball.
Two lines which are a vertical and a horizontal line in the middle simply follow the shape of the ball.
The other two lines are curved lines conforming to the shape of the ball.
Color the background.
tyn_section: Orange coloring utensil (along with darker and lighter shades of the original color)
